newsitem.title: GERMANY: Daimler - exchange into Cap Gemini a success.
newsitem.headline: Daimler - exchange into Cap Gemini a success.

text.p: German conglomerate Daimler-Benz and its unit Daimler-Benz InterServices (debis) on Monday announced the offering of notes exchangeable into shares of French group Cap Gemini SA had been successfully completed.
In a statement Daimler said the deal "was successfully completed and priced at noon on June 30, 1997".
Daimler will receive about 1.35 billion marks ($776 million) in proceeds from the transaction before an oversubscription green-shoe option is excercised.
Daimler said a total principal amount of $350 million and 2.5 billion French francs ($426 million) was placed with institutional investors in Europe.

The exchange price was set at 352 francs per share which is a premium of 15 percent over the share price at the time the books were closed on June 30, 1997, Daimler said. The transaction is expected to close on July 30, 1997. ($ = 1.739 German Marks) ($ = 5.865 French Francs)
